input_text:
Job Title: Process Engineer

Location: Boise, ID

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!

We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.

The Process Engineer (PE) is a critical member of Creation's Engineering Team and subject matter expert (SME) in equipment and methods of manufacturing circuit card assembly (CCA) and/or box assembly. The PE understands and executes equipment selection, performance, maintenance, and validation. PE will work in collaboration to analyze and resolve a variety of technical issues related to quality and manufacturing. The PE will ensure equipment utilization to its capabilities and optimizes performance. This position directly reports to the Process Engineering Leader.

DUTIES/ RESPONSIBILITIES: 

Develop, configure and optimize industrial processesInterface with the Project Engineers, Production Associates, Process

Process Engineers and Management to support a six (6) day a week manufacturing operation and achieve the following:

 Improved efficiency (Performance to Standard, Turn around time, Changeover time) High first pass yields (SMT, TH) Best quality (DPMO)Work on continuous improvement of the processes on the production floor to improve quality and cycle time by focusing on: Defect data analysis Assembly tools and fixtures Automation of processes and equipment Elimination of redundant and non-value-added operations Optimizing the product flow Proactively pursue better methods and/or new technologies in order to assist the customer in improving the product design and enabling Creation to produce a better product, cost effectively Key focus on surface mount assembly equipment including pick and place, printing and reflow to enhance equipment performance, support the operators in on-going process improvement and training

QUALIFICATIONS:

Manufacturing Process Expert in the area of SMT or Wave solderingMinimum 5 years of process engineering experience or equivalent direct technical support of an electronics assembly processKnowledge of Process control methodologies (SPC, Cp, Cpk,)Process Expert in one or more of SMT, Wave soldering, and Mechanical AssemblyMust have excellent communication skills, technical writing abilities, analytical skills, be a team player and able to take independent decisions related to the job functionAt least four years of manufacturing experience in electronic manufacturing with a focus on SMT or Wave solderingKnowledge of IPC documentationApplication of Six sigma and lean manufacturing principlesAble to flex schedule in support six (6) day a week manufacturing operation, as needed

If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

Canada: Title for the position will be in accordance with applicable national and local laws.

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Process Engineer
output_json.summary: A critical member of the Engineering Team, subject matter expert in equipment and manufacturing methods.
job_responsibilities: Develops, configures, and optimizes industrial processes
Interfaces with Project Engineers, Production Associates, Process Engineers, and Management
Improves efficiency, high first pass yields, and best quality
Focuses on defect data analysis, assembly tools and fixtures, automation of processes and equipment
Proactively pursues better methods and new technologies
Assists in improving product design and enabling the company to produce better products cost-effectively
output_json.company_information: Fun company with a belief in what they're doing, committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: Equal opportunity employer considering race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, and any other characteristic protected by law.
